# Live Peers
</div>
###### Chain ID: `junction` | Current Node Version: `v0.1.0`

## All Live Peers for Airchains
Here is a list of 59 active peers as observed by [NODERS]TEAM in real-time. Add them to your `config.toml` if you have trouble finding peers.


Here is a script for you to update `persistent_peers` setting in `config.toml`. Stale peers can cause node inefficiency over time, so the script below selects a few random live peers.

```bash
PEERS=8d69ea5c40c7ba7c84b7520920f0327ea801bd5f@62.169.17.22:26656,e0972ddd1b61ee38de11d7cb4b08c801d4654cf5@5.180.81.222:656,c16f0b5f7f19df0d99c1699cd2322625f4085915@152.53.15.66:26656,894ea1c8d4b66b886dfdc249659e8008d70e12b0@2a00:43456,76465ca659b8de35e5c4366ea561b6b6f2662197@62.169.25.68:63656
sed -i.bak -e "s/^persistent_peers *=.*/persistent_peers = \"$PEERS\"/" ~/.junction/config/config.toml

sudo systemctl restart junctiond
sudo journalctl -fu junctiond --no-hostname -o cat
```

## Our peer for Airchains
When you state-sync, you might also consider adding [NODERS]TEAM state-sync peer to your persistent_peers setting in `config.toml`.

```bash
7ebc08bbef4bd2b4da8d881474710a2500854c2b@airchain-t-rpc.noders.services:31656
```
